definition: hands dance and feet trip (idiom); dancing and gesticulating for joy
hand/(formal) to hold/person engaged in certain types of work/person skilled in certain types of work/personal(ly)/convenient/classifier for skill/CL:雙|双[shuang1],隻|只[zhi1]
to dance/to wield/to brandish
excessive
foot/to be sufficient/ample
to tread on/to trample/to stamp/to fulfill/Taiwan pr. [dao4]

sentences.english: He is all flourishes, rococo gestures, and exquisite manners.
sentences.chinese: 他手舞足蹈，優雅地比劃着繁雜的手勢。

sentences.english: Knowledge makes one laugh, but wealth makes onlne dance.
sentences.chinese: 知識使人笑逐顏開，財富使人手舞足蹈。

sentences.english: Knowledge make one laugh, but wealth make one dance.
sentences.chinese: 知識使人笑口常開，財富使人手舞足蹈。

sentences.english: Inquisitive, he tasted the leaves and began to dance around.
sentences.chinese: 好奇之下，他品嚐了樹葉，然後開始手舞足蹈。

sentences.english: Mollie jumps up on her hind legs and does a little dance every time I walk in the door.
sentences.chinese: 當我走進家門，莫莉會手舞足蹈地跳起來。

sentences.english: It gladdened him greatly, clapping his head with shout and dancing wildly.
sentences.chinese: 他拍手大叫，手舞足蹈一番，這才順着石級走下。

sentences.english: He always gesticulated merrily when he had a talk.
sentences.chinese: 他講起話來總是手舞足蹈的。

sentences.english: Cheng dances into the kitchen coquettishly, with his own disk in hand.
sentences.chinese: 鄭正很騷地出場，拿着自己的光盤手舞足蹈來到餐廳。

sentences.english: Either way, Turiaf has moved a step beyond towel-waving status.
sentences.chinese: 另一種方法，把屠夫移到那個繼續手舞足蹈的地位。

sentences.english: The song makes us dance for joy.
sentences.chinese: 那支歌曲令我們手舞足蹈。

definition: overjoyed (idiom); as pleased as punch
smiles of exultation/radiant with delight
happy and excited (idiom)/in high spirits/in great delight
to hop/to jump
to shout and quarrel/to make a big fuss
to sway to and fro/to rock back and forth
shouting and screaming (idiom); to scream loudly/to rant/to kick up a racket/to conduct vigorous propaganda
to jump/to bounce/to hop
excited/in high spirits
to laugh heartily/to burst into loud laughter
very loudly/at the top of one's voice
unable to contain one's joy (idiom)
to shout/to bellow one's grievances
joyfully satisfied/to be immensely proud of oneself/proudly/an air of complacency
bouncing and vivacious
to gesticulate/to make lively gestures (while talking)/also written 比手畫腳|比手画脚
